artist: Artist: Miguel Rodriguez-Acosta Carlstróm; Author: Federico García Lorca; Publisher: Maeght Barcelona, Spain
description: unbound book housed in brown buckram portfolio cover and black cloth-covered slipcase; embossing; color abstract images and text; loose volume; additional three signed loose prints in back
image_copyright: © Miguel Rodriguez-Acosta%2C Federico Garcia Lorca %2F Maeght Barcelona%2C publisher

Numbered in pencil on colophon page: 16
Watermark: Arches France
medium: Color aquatints and embossing, with letterpress on cream paper; loose in portfolio
provenance: William P. Kosmas, London, England (d. 2017); Estate of William P. Kosmas, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
signed:
Signed in pencil on colophon page: Miguel Rodriguez-Acosta
Signed and dated in pencil on three loose prints: M. Rodriguez-Acosta │ 79 (These are numbered 16/25)
text: Sonetos del Amor Oscuro (Sonnets of Dark Love) was one of the last series of poems written by the celebrated Spanish avant-garde poet and playwright Federico García Lorca (1898–1936). Infused with themes of longing, desire, and forbidden love, the poems were written in 1935, inspired by Lorca’s secret love affair with 19-year-old Juan Ramírez de Lucas. The poems remained unpublished until 1984, though unauthorized editions were released earlier, including this book.
title: Sonnets of Dark Love
